subject: Technology
title: Edison vs Tesla: The War of Currents
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Edison vs Tesla: The War of Currents.

hook.text: Two brilliant inventors fought over how to deliver electricity. One electrocuted an elephant to win the argument.

buildup.text: Edison championed direct current. Tesla and Westinghouse backed alternating current. Only one could wire America.

discovery.text: AC could travel long distances over thin wires. DC lost power quickly and needed a power station every mile.

twist.text: Edison publicly electrocuted animals with AC to prove it was dangerous. The smear campaign was ruthless.

climax.text: AC won. Tesla's system powers the entire modern grid. Edison's DC makes a quiet comeback in electronics and solar.

punchline.text: Tesla won the war of currents. Edison won the fame.

quiz.question: Why did alternating current win over direct current?
options: It could travel long distances without losing power
